abstract: Roberta Smith reviews final showing of traveling exhibit Power and Pathos: Bronze Sculpture of the Hellenistic World, featuring sculptures by various artists, at National Gallery of Art in Washington.
lead_paragraph: This landmark exhibition at the National Gallery of Art in Washington is a corrective to the usual view that the Hellenistic era represented a decline in art.

headline.main: ‘Power and Pathos’: Hellenistic Bronzes as Realism in the Flesh
headline.print_headline: Reality Check for Derided Era of Art

snippet: This landmark exhibition at the National Gallery of Art in Washington is a corrective to the usual view that the Hellenistic era represented a decline in art.
